messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] sandra's re to Motherly Fustration
messages.messageBody:
<<Here's the original:

Motherly frustration can't be avoided, but wallowing in it, becoming
a martyr, or blaming children for being so inconvenient CAN be avoided!

Don't put it on a car. Too much reading. <g> You might get rear-ended.

Sandra>>



I put it on my refrigerator up on the freezer door where anyone who's in my
house, me included, can stop, read and ponder it. And maybe go home and be
a nicer mom and have happier kids.



Janet

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] sandra's re to Motherly Fustration
messages.msgSnippet: ... I didn t write marter did I? Get that edited before you stick it on your car!  I have fumble-fingered some things lately, so it s within the realm of
messages.messageBody:
On May 13, 2006, at 1:42 PM, jeans5kids wrote:

> *Motherly Fustration can't be avioded but wallowing in it or being a
> marter for it can*


I didn't write "marter" did I?
Get that edited before you stick it on your car! <g>


I have fumble-fingered some things lately, so it's within the realm
of recent errors.

Here's the original:

Motherly frustration can't be avoided, but wallowing in it, becoming
a martyr, or blaming children for being so inconvenient CAN be avoided!

Don't put it on a car. Too much reading. <g> You might get rear-ended.

Sandra

messages.subject: sandra's re to Motherly Fustration
messages.msgSnippet: Wow Sandra you just coined a bumper sticker for me : *Motherly Fustration can t be avioded but wallowing in it or being a marter for it can* You are soo smart
messages.messageBody:
Wow Sandra you just coined a bumper sticker for me :
*Motherly Fustration can't be avioded but wallowing in it or being a
marter for it can*
You are soo smart I love the saying I wish I could post it everywhere
(because just about everyone needs to be reminded about that every
once in a while)

thanks for your wisdom
jean
